caption.title: Conceptual model of the possible role of recrudescence in the persistence of Hendra virus in isolated flying-fox populations representing the daily dynamics of a colony consisting of (A) the various life history stages (pups, P; juveniles, J; pre-reproductive sub-adults, SA; reproductively mature adults, A), and (B) the various disease stages (maternally immune young-of-the-year, Mi; susceptible, S; exposed and latently infected, E; infectious, I; and recovered, R) individuals.
